skillTree.localised_description: The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless Ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Those atop the mighty Moon Drakes are steeled in the knowledge of their mount’s enlightened strength that has seen them face down Daemons.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
With precise applications of unmaking, any threat may be rendered null and void in turn.
Mere talent alone is not enough, one must be truly gifted to be chosen to study at the Tower of Hoeth.

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Djaf's Incantation of Cursed Blades Upgraded

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in battle, this Lord will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Asuryan's adherents believe they are part of the Creator's plan and will never be abandoned.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The supporters of Hoeth bask in their patron's generosity, for it was he who gifted the Elves with much of their revered knowledge.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The God of Smiths knows the Elves will need fire and fury to survive; his blessings steel them for the darker days ahead.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Isha's husband is the father of all Elves; his blessings are given to those who hunt for food, but woe betide those who kill for sport.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for White Lions of Chrace, War Lions and Lion Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for White Lions of Chrace, War Lions and Lion Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: The Goddess of Fertility blesses farmers and mothers, but also those votaries who are caught abroad in dangerous lands.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who follow the Bringer of Wrath and Fire are blessed with direct and forceful solutions to the obstacles in their way.
As the Lord of the Sea, Mathlann is patron to sailors and explorers; he is prayed to by Elves about to embark on a voyage or seeking new lands.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If you can hold you ground when all around are falling into the cracks, then that's the patronage of Hukon, God of Earthquakes.
Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Awakening of the Wood"

skillTree.localised_description: Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.
The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Earth Blood"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Earth Blood Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Earth Blood Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell temporarily transforms allies' mortal flesh into unbreakable rock, increasing tenfold their resistance to attack.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Archmage crackles and flows with energies that would unmake any mortal practitioner.
By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Regrowth Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell causes gnarled, fibrous hands to emerge from beneath the ground, dragging the foe to a claustrophobic, suffocating end.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Dwellers Below"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units

Melee defence: +8 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Missile combat isn't always about attacking; knowing how to defend also pays dividends.

Ammunition: +8% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn and Bolt Thrower units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Years of experience in mounted combat has started to pay off; this one is always in command of both their force and its steeds.

effects.description:
Speed: +5% for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +9% for Ellyrian Reavers units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +7% for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Being present at the very forefront of the assault, on many occasions, prepares one for future engagements of a similar nature.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Chariot, War Lion and Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Chariot, War Lion and Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Chariot, War Lion and Dragon Princes units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The firmament holds no fear for this one, such is their command of the many airborne beasts of battle.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Great Eagle, Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Great Eagle, Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Great Eagle, Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Great Eagle, Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Great Eagle, Phoenix and Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing that it is the rare plan that survives contact with the enemy, yet being prepared for all eventualities, raises this one above mere planners.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Like a wall of the hardest stone imaginable - such is their ability to withstand attack.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Silver Helms, Swordmasters of Hoeth and White Lions of Chrace units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Silver Helms, Swordmasters of Hoeth and White Lions of Chrace units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Magic resistance: 15% for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Silver Helms, Swordmasters of Hoeth and White Lions of Chrace units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the gale always blows in the direction of your choosing, failure becomes a rare event indeed.

Missile strength: +12% for Archers and Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn and Bolt Thrower units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 10% for Archers, Lothern Sea Guard, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn and Bolt Thrower units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Speed, agility and control - all must be mastered if your crushing tide is to break perfectly upon enemy shores.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Rangers, Great Eagle, War Lion, Chariot and Ellyrian Reavers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Rangers, Great Eagle, War Lion, Chariot and Ellyrian Reavers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Rangers, Great Eagle, War Lion, Chariot and Ellyrian Reavers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The very centre of the fire always burns the hottest.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Dragon, Phoenixes, Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Dragon, Phoenixes, Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 5% for Dragon, Phoenixes, Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -3% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -8% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This character has arcane conduit innately.
Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.
This one can never leave something alone. They always have to meddle.

effects.description:
Construction cost: +10% for all buildings
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Much of the Ulthuan skyline built over the last thousand years is down to this one’s sterling endeavours.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If it requires accuracy and organisation, this one is your Elf. Not so much fun at parties, however.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -15% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction time: -20% for all buildings
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: There's usually a right way and a wrong way to do anything. This one generally gets it wrong.
"Too late, too late!" will be the cry, when the one with the bargains passes you by.
"There's always a way – always an angle. You just have to find it."
Machinery – and indeed progress of any kind – is anathema to this one, because there's no substitute for good, honest toil.
Fortunately, there are some who really apply themselves to the problems of the world. Just as well, otherwise we'd be… Oh wait...
An individual of exceptional skill and worth; the very embodiment of sagacity.

effects.description:
Enemy Hero action success chance: -25%
	(enemy characters in region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: They say two are better than one. They are, of course, totally wrong in every respect.
Impressively energetic for a thousand years old – even by their own reckoning.
"Staying this supple takes effort. You don’t get definition like that by sitting about and drinking."
Looking "not too well" has become a permanent condition. Clearly, they're lacking essential herbs.
Chance is like magic – it can be harnessed to the individual's will.
"If you need anything, there are guards outside the doors. Many guards."

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If ever there was a candidate for a relaxing break at an all-inclusive spa, it was this one.
Every fibre of their being is charged and ready for action – wherever, whenever.
Through their veins a charge is racing. Energy, filling the ominous void within.
This one doesn't even relax in their own company, so reserved is their nature.
Definitely not the life and soul of the party; they exude melancholy and depression.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve: -8
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Not every cloud has a silver lining.
Cool, calm, and collected. Yeah, right!
Action, inaction, change – you name it, this one will work against the prevailing wind.
Whatever quality is needed to stand guard over the Asur way of life, this one has it in abundance.
Fortitude? Strength of character? Do me a favour – this yellow-bellied poltroon has none.

effects.description:
Recruitment duration: +1 turn for Phoenix units (minimum 1)
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Tempers, like wicks, can be ignited. Watch the anger burn.

effects.description:
Ward save: 5% for Phoenix units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: You don't want to be on the wrong side of this one's ire – it's explosive to say the least!
